definition[0]: to travel in a curved path around a much larger object such as the Earth, the Sun etc
example[0]: The satellite orbits the Earth every 48 hours.
definition[1]: the curved path travelled by an object which is moving around another much larger object such as the Earth, the Sun etc

example[2]: The space shuttle is now in orbit.
example[3]: The telecommunications satellite went into orbit at the end of last year.
definition[2]: the area of power and influence of a person, an organization etc
example[4]: countries within the orbit of the British Commonwealth
